node.title: Joe Manchin Raises New Questions About Social Spending Bill
node.alt: Senator Joe Manchin on Monday demanded a vote on the bipartisan infrastructure bill as negotiations on President Joe Biden's "Build Back Better" bill continue. Above, Manchin reacts during a press conference as he talks about his position on Biden's sweeping economic plan on Monday.
node.description: "The political games have to stop," the West Virginia Democrat said during a news conference.
node.content:
["Senator Joe Manchin implored his Democratic colleagues to hold an immediate vote on the bipartisan infrastructure bill as negotiations over President Joe Biden's social spending package continue.", "Manchin also raised new questions about the $1.75 social spending plan released by the White House last week. The West Virginia senator said he won't support the bill until there is \"greater clarity\" about the impact it will have on inflation and the national debt.", "The $1.2 trillion infrastructure framework\u2014also known as BIF, for Bipartisan Infrastructure Framework\u2014passed the Senate in August. But the legislation has been stalled in the House of Representatives as Democrats try to reach agreement on Biden's economic legislation.", "\"In my view, this is not how the United States Congress should operate,\" Manchin said at a news conference Monday. \"The political games have to stop. Twice now the House has balked at the opportunity to send the BIF legislation to the president.\"", "He continued, \"It is time to vote on the BIF bill up or down and then go home and explain to your constituents the decision you made.\"", "Progressives have threatened to tank the infrastructure bill unless the chamber also holds a vote on Biden's broader spending plan to expand the social safety net and combat climate change.", "Manchin is a critical vote in the Senate as Democrats attempt to pass Biden's multitrillion-dollar spending bill via reconciliation, a legislative process that will allow the party to bypass the 60-vote filibuster rule.", "\"Holding this bill hostage is not going to work and getting my support for the reconciliation bill,\" Manchin said.", "This is a developing story and will be updated with more information as it becomes available.", "", "
